intro: Aspidogyne caraguatatubensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit tree, is a species native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces a unique fruit that resembles a star, hence its common name. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem and a system of roots adapted to the nutrient-poor soils of the rainforest. Aspidogyne caraguatatubensis is of interest to botanists due to its potential medicinal properties and ecological significance in its native habitat.
